H0.text: Melting is the temperature at which a substance changes from solid to liquid.

H1.text: Boiling is the temperature at which a substance melts.

H2.text: Change is the temperature at which a substance melts.

H3.text: Freezing is the temperature at which a substance melts.

A4.text: The melting point of a substance is the temperature at which it changes state from solid to liquid.

A5.text: When considered as the temperature of the reverse change from liquid to solid, it is referred to as the freezing point or crystallization point.
